name: The Boha-Nazca Case Files
description:
This is an adventure, mystery open-world 3D game with rich story-line spanning across various continents. It is a work of fiction, but heavily inspired by real-life events and based on various traditions passed on through generations.

The year is 2014. The protagonist - Aryan - is an investigative assistant working for the department of A.S.I. (Archeological Survey of India). Recently, a renowned french archaeologist - Dr. Ortmeyer - has found some very interesting geoglyphs in the Thar desert of Rajasthan state of India near a village named Boha. These are some of the largest man-made carvings on the soil. It is very similar to the 2000 years old geoglyphs found in Nazca, Peru. He has collaborated with the govt. and the protagonist is sent to investigate further.

 As you reach the land of the Kings (Rajasthan), you come to know that the titular prince of this province - Kunwar Raj Singh - is also very interested in this excavation. He has lent support to the A.S.I. He has sent one of his most powerful car for your perusal, along with a trustworthy assistant, named Veer Singh. He will escort you around, as you gather evidences to uncover mystery of Boha
